DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Donor Central Venous Access Catheter Anatomic Site Other Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the other location on or within the human body of the central line placement.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Donor Central Venous Access Catheter Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._A tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs. It also can be used to obtain blood samples. This device avoids the need for separate needle insertions for each infusion or blood test. Examples of these devices include Hickman catheters, which require clamps to make sure the valve is closed, and Groshong catheters, which have a valve that opens as fluid is withdrawn or infused and remains closed when not in use._Named locations of, or within, the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.

Property.preferredName: Central Venous Access Catheter Anatomic Site
Property.preferredDefinition: A tube surgically placed into a blood vessel for the purpose of giving intravenous fluid and drugs. It also can be used to obtain blood samples. This device avoids the need for separate needle insertions for each infusion or blood test. Examples of these devices include Hickman catheters, which require clamps to make sure the valve is closed, and Groshong catheters, which have a valve that opens as fluid is withdrawn or infused and remains closed when not in use.:Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: A venous catheter positioned with the tip in the proximal third of the superior vena cava, the right atrium, or the inferior vena cava.
Named locations of or within the body.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the other specified free-text field related to an anatomic site.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: locations or structures in the human body.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.
